resources:
MyCity
Japanese Garden The Botanical Garden is located in the Troja Valley and covers an area of approximately 25 hectares. Its most famous part is the Fata Morgana greenhouse, but the garden also includes outdoor exhibitions, including a vineyard. The Fata Morgana greenhouse is open year-round from Tuesday to Sunday, with Monday being the closing day. Trojská 800/196, 171 00 Praha-Troja +420 234 148 122 January – February: 09:00 – 16:00
March – October: 09:00 – 19:00
November – December: 09:00 – 16:00
Shopping centre Palladium Palladium is a shopping mall located in the centre of Prague in the Czech Republic. It opened in 2007. The mall contains 170 shops and 30 restaurants, with a retail area of 39,000 square metres (420,000 sq ft).[1] There is also designated office space in the building totalling 19,500 square metres (210,000 sq ft).[2] It is one of the biggest shopping centres in the Czech Republic. It is directly opposite another shopping centre, Kotva Department Store. Nám. Republiky 1079/1a, 110 00 Praha +420 225 770 250 09:00 – 21:00
Shopping centre Černy most A modern shopping centre nearby the Černý most metro station and the Černý most bus terminal. The spacious building hides an area of ​​ nearly 85,000 square meters with 176 retail units and 3,000 parking spaces. There are shops, 30 restaurants, a fitness centre and a cinema., Chlumecká 765/6, 198 19 Praha 9-Černý Most +420 281 918 100 09:00 – 21:00
Troja Castle Troja Castle is a Baroque building located in the Troja district of PragueWithin its premises, there are several farm buildings, including a stable. The castle also had a vineyard and the Chapel of St. Clare (to the north), which is now part of the Botanical Garden. The castle is surrounded by an extensive castle garden with decorative and fruit trees, a small natural maze, fountains, terracotta vases, stucco facades, and an orangery with busts of emperors. The castle, along with the garden, is owned by the City of Prague and is open to the public. The Prague City Gallery holds seasonal exhibitions here from April to October. Inside the castle, you can see unique frescoes decorating the halls. U trojského zámku 4/1170 00 Praha 7 +420 283 851 614 Monday: closed
Tuesday – Thursday: 10:00 – 18:00
Friday: 13:00–18:00
Saturday – Sunday: 10:00 – 18:00
Note: the castle is completely closed in winter. Ticket: 150 Kč
Family ticket: 250 Kč
Senior ticket: 20 Kč
